intro: Oxyspora hirticalyx, commonly known as the hairy oxyspora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Oxyspora hirticalyx is often found in shaded areas of forests and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
